JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Position Information: Employs innovative techniques to improve the overall wellbeing of patients by diagnosing and treating disorders, diseases, and injuries of the foot and lower leg.
Essential Duties:
Diagnoses and treats disorders, diseases, and injuries of the foot and lower leg, including corns, calluses, ingrown toenails, bunions, heel spurs, and arch problems.
Ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections, and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases.
Refers patients to other physicians who will provide appropriate care.
Maintains working relationships with other healthcare providers on campus.
Identifies potential clinical research projects related to foot diseases, disorders, and diabetes, and participates in clinical research initiated by other investigators.

Well known Podiatry group in Beverly Hills looking for the right-minded podiatrist to join our team of friendly, motivated professionals ingrained in a cultural of teamwork, collaboration and collegiality that cuts across specialties and departments. We are expanding to the Los Alamitos, Encino and Marina Del Rey area. Driven by a dynamic, transparent leadership team, physician involvement is a key focus, enabling constant improvements delivering high-quality care.
We are looking for a Podiatrist that provides service to our in office patients, skilled nursing home patients, wound care patients and hospitals. The Podiatrist services to patients in skilled nursing facilities. He/she will diagnose and treat minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles, and lower legs using a variety of testing and treatment methods. The Podiatrist will be assisted by a medical assistant and will perform analysis, pain relief management, and treatment on-site to patients/residents at the SNF location. He/she will diagnose diseases and deformities of the foot, ankle, and leg using a variety of testing methods, will surgically treat conditions such as corns, calluses, ingrown nails, tumors, shortened tendons, bunions, cysts, and abscesses, and will prescribe medications, corrective devices, physical therapy, or surgery as needed. The Podiatrist will advise residents about treatments and foot care techniques and will treat bone, muscle, and joint disorders. The Podiatrist will see patients in our main office or satellite offices as needed. Salary negotiable.

Position Overview: The role of a Certified Clinical Medical Assistant is to provide care to patients/significant others via direct and/or telephone contact, following established standards and practices. S/he coordinates with other members of the care team to ensure seamless care delivery, maximal coordination of efforts, and active patient participation in planning and care. Assists physician or other provider with clinical procedures.

Typical Physical Demands: Requires full range of body motion including moving and lifting patients, manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. Requires sitting and/or standing for extended periods of time. Occasionally exerts up to 100 pounds of force, such as assisting patients in arising from the exam table, pushing patients in wheelchairs, or assisting patients into/out of wheelchairs. Requires corrected vision and hearing to normal range. May require occasional lifting and carrying office supplies.

Typical Working Conditions: May require frequent exposure to communicable diseases and body fluids, toxic substances, medicinal preparations, and other substances and conditions common to a medical office environment. Requires working in close proximity to other personnel. Requires use of computer keyboard throughout the work day. May require use of autoclave for instrument sterilization. Requires working under stressful conditions and/or working irregular hours.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Position Overview: The role of a Certified Clinical Medical Assistant is to provide care to patients/significant others via direct and/or telephone contact, following established standards and practices. S/he coordinates with other members of the care team to ensure seamless care delivery, maximal coordination of efforts, and active patient participation in planning and care. Assists physician or other provider with clinical procedures.

Typical Physical Demands: Requires full range of body motion including moving and lifting patients, manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. Requires sitting and/or standing for extended periods of time. Occasionally exerts up to 100 pounds of force, such as assisting patients in arising from the exam table, pushing patients in wheelchairs, or assisting patients into/out of wheelchairs. Requires corrected vision and hearing to normal range. May require occasional lifting and carrying office supplies.

Typical Working Conditions: May require frequent exposure to communicable diseases and body fluids, toxic substances, medicinal preparations, and other substances and conditions common to a medical office environment. Requires working in close proximity to other personnel. Requires use of computer keyboard throughout the work day. May require use of autoclave for instrument sterilization. Requires working under stressful conditions and/or working irregular hours.

Job Title: Medical Assistant I Certified - Carolina Foot & Ankle Admin
Job Description:
Description
Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 diverse employees, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.
Summary:
The Medical Assistant I, Certified provides routine clinical and administrative support to providers and other health care team members in an outpatient clinic setting. The Medical Assistant I, Certified works under the clinical supervision of the provider for patient care activities, and under the general direction of the designated manager/supervisor for non-clinical responsibilities.

Responsibilities:
1. Performs rooming and/or intake process, collecting and data, including vital signs, height, weight, and data related to patient’s reason for visit.
2. Collects patient and family data, including medical and social history.
3. Reviews patient’s current medication list, allergies and preferred pharmacy.
4. Assists the provider as directed, during treatments, examinations and procedures.
5. Collects specimens and performs phlebotomy.
6. Administers medications under the direction of a provider.
7. Performs tests, for examples EKG, eye exams, under the direction of a provider.
8. Reviews the patient record to determine whether patient requires any routine health screenings.
9. Ensures exam/procedure room contains appropriate supplies, equipment, forms and educational materials are available and ready for use during visit/procedure.
10. Provides patient with after-visit, follow-up, self-care or procedural instructions and/or educational materials as directed.
11. Prepares, cleans, stocks and maintains exam and treatment rooms.
12. Cleans and sterilizes instruments.
13. Assists with patient registration, check in/check out, appointment scheduling, and scheduling of tests and treatments, and referrals.
14. Answers clinic telephone and assists in-basket under the direction of a provider or nurse.
15. Assists in emergency situations as directed by a provider or nurse.

The purpose of this position is to provide faculty support to meet the teaching, research and patient care needs of the Department of Orthopedic Surgery and assist in fulfilling UTMB's threefold mission.
The person in this position is responsible for providing direct patient care, consultative services, outpatient services and care of hospitalized patients. Duke University Hospital has 957 inpatient beds and offers comprehensive diagnostic and therapeutic facilities, including a regional emergency/trauma center; a major surgery suite containing 51 operating rooms; an endo-surgery center; an Ambulatory Surgery Center with nine operating rooms and an extensive diagnostic and interventional radiology area. In fiscal year 2018, Duke University Hospital admitted 42,916 patients and had 1,085,740 outpatient visits in fiscal year 2017.

U.S News & World Report named Duke University Hospital #1 in North Carolina and #1 in the Raleigh-Durham area in 2018-19.

POSITION SUMMARY
The podiatrist will provided quality primary podiatric care and emergency treatment to KVHC patients while participating in appropriate supervision, coordination, and implementation of heath care programs and procedures. The primary focus of this position will be the podiatric medical treatment of clinical manifestations of systemic diseases including diabetes and the treatment of common podiatric conditions. The podiatrist will work as part of the Care Team to ensure effective and quality care is given to the KVHC patient.
RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Provide preventative care, diagnosis and treatment of problems affecting the feet and ankle. Provides emergency podiatric care to assure total patient care.

We are looking for a Podiatrist to diagnose and treat minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles and the lower part of legs. Podiatrist responsibilities include conducting foot and ankle surgeries, prescribing orthotics and applying therapeutic treatments for issues like arthritis, fractures and feet corn and calluses. To be considered for this role, you should have a doctoral degree in Podiatric Medicine and practical experience in a clinic or hospital. Ultimately, you will give our patients the best treatment based on their condition and help them recover as soon as possible.
Responsibilities
Examine patients’ legs to diagnose diseases
Perform foot and ankle surgeries (for example, removing bone spurs)
Treat sport-related foot and leg injuries, like fractures

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Duke University Hospital is consistently rated as one of the best in the United States and is known around the world for its outstanding care and groundbreaking research. Are you inspired by helping people? So are we!
Who We Are:
iConsult Healthcare, Inc. is a multi-specialty telemedicine group, specializing in providing high quality accessible consultative services to patients wherever they may reside. iConsult’s mission is to provide our patients with quality, timely, compassionate care in the setting they currently reside.
Our service has been designed to provide seamless and effective care to you and your patients. Our process begins with an iConsult physician who evaluates the patient at a convenient time. With access to medical records prior to the visit, we can improve the patient care experience and provide a thorough and complete consult. Our services address the range of patient care needs and eliminate the alternative time-consuming physician office visit or costly emergency room visit, which could lead to a readmission.

POSITION SUMMARY
The podiatrist will provided quality primary podiatric care and emergency treatment to KVHC patients while participating in appropriate supervision, coordination, and implementation of heath care programs and procedures. The primary focus of this position will be the podiatric medical treatment of clinical manifestations of systemic diseases including diabetes and the treatment of common podiatric conditions. The podiatrist will work as part of the Care Team to ensure effective and quality care is given to the KVHC patient.
RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Provide preventative care, diagnosis and treatment of problems affecting the feet and ankle. Provides emergency podiatric care to assure total patient care.

Be a hospital-employed physician at a community-owned and physician-led health system
Salary guarantee or your work RVUs, whichever is greater

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Our services address the range of patient care needs and eliminate the alternative time-consuming physician office visit or costly emergency room visit, which could lead to a readmission.

We are looking for a Podiatrist to diagnose and treat minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles and the lower part of legs. Podiatrist responsibilities include conducting foot and ankle surgeries, prescribing orthotics and applying therapeutic treatments for issues like arthritis, fractures and feet corn and calluses. Treat sport-related foot and leg injuries, like fractures

Summary
Elite Foot and Ankle is a busy practice in the heart of Burbank, CA. Our practice covers all areas of general podiatry as well as surgery, trauma, and wound care. Our practice utilizes a state-of-the-art EHR, in-house digital x-rays, and in-house ultrasound.
We are looking for a full-time associate for all aspects of general podiatry. Our ideal candidate is eager to learn and work with the senior partner/doctor as well as show an ability to bring in new patients. Requirements

We are seeking a Board eligible/certified Podiatrist for 3-4 days per week.
We are a busy independent pain management practice located in the Metro West area of suburban Boston with 2 NP’s, and a fluoroscopy suite, with radiofrequency and extensive use of ultrasound.
You will be joining 1 Physician and 2 Nurse Practitioners focused on office based interventional procedures. Specifically, you will be focusing on ultrasound guided procedures and we are willing to train you. You will work collaboratively with our Medical Director.
The ideal candidate will have competence in procedures, excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, a successful work ethic and a record of excellence in medical education and practice.

Advanced Foot & Ankle Center is a rapidly growing company of podiatrists in the Utah market. We are currently searching for a talented Podiatristto join our team! You'll use your clinical and interpersonal skills to provide high-quality care to our patients. The ideal candidate is committed to delivering quality patient care to individuals of all ages, diagnosing, and treating minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles, and the lower legs. Our group has a high focus on diabetic ulcers and wound care within our clinics.
The individual hired for this position will spend 3-4 days per week in the clinical setting or performing surgeries. They will spend the other 1-2 days per week performing mobile visits with a focus on diabetic wound care. As your practice grows and volume requires, you will have the option to transition your mobile days into clinic days instead.

Examine patients’ legs and feet to diagnose diseases

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Job Title: Physician: Foot and Ankle Orthopedic Surgery Opportunity in Texas | JOB-2620612
Job Description:
A new orthopedic surgeon opportunity is now available in Texas. Both newly trained foot and ankle fellows or general orthopedists with foot and ankle experience will be considered. Mondays and Wednesdays are OR days, clinic is on Tuesday, Thursday, and ½ day Friday, and call is 1:5. Each surgeon has a scribe. They will consider board certified and board eligible candidates, and both 2020 and 2021 fellows. The patient experience and quality of care is very important for them.
This position offers a two-year salary guarantee as you ramp up to an RVU model and production/performance bonuses paid quarterly. You will also receive malpractice insurance, medical benefits, life/disability insurance, CME, a retirement plan, a sign-on bonus, and relocation assistance.
At CompHealth, we are experts at matching you with your just-right job. Every step of the way, you will be supported by specialty teams comprised of tenured professionals. Our goal is to make a difference in the lives of our physicians and the healthcare communities they serve.

Treat sport-related foot and leg injuries, like fractures

We are seeking a Board eligible/certified Podiatrist for 3-4 days per week.
We are a busy independent pain management practice located in the Metro West area of suburban Boston with 2 NP’s, and a fluoroscopy suite, with radiofrequency and extensive use of ultrasound.
You will be joining 1 Physician and 2 Nurse Practitioners focused on office based interventional procedures. Specifically, you will be focusing on ultrasound guided procedures and we are willing to train you. You will work collaboratively with our Medical Director.
The ideal candidate will have competence in procedures, excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, a successful work ethic and a record of excellence in medical education and practice.

This is a perfect position for a candidate who is looking for a part-time position. The part-time position may be converted to a full time position in the future if desired.
Requirements

We are looking for a Podiatrist to diagnose and treat minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles and the lower part of legs. Podiatrist responsibilities include conducting foot and ankle surgeries, prescribing orthotics and applying therapeutic treatments for issues like arthritis, fractures and feet corn and calluses. To be considered for this role, you should have a doctoral degree in Podiatric Medicine and practical experience in a clinic or hospital. Ultimately, you will give our patients the best treatment based on their condition and help them recover as soon as possible.
Responsibilities
Examine patients’ legs to diagnose diseases
Perform foot and ankle surgeries (for example, removing bone spurs)
Treat sport-related foot and leg injuries, like fractures

We are seeking a Board eligible/certified Podiatrist for 3-4 days per week.
We are a busy independent pain management practice located in the Metro West area of suburban Boston with 2 NP’s, and a fluoroscopy suite, with radiofrequency and extensive use of ultrasound.
You will be joining 1 Physician and 2 Nurse Practitioners focused on office based interventional procedures. Specifically, you will be focusing on ultrasound guided procedures and we are willing to train you. You will work collaboratively with our Medical Director.
The ideal candidate will have competence in procedures, excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, a successful work ethic and a record of excellence in medical education and practice.

Job Title: Physician: Podiatrist Opportunity in North Dakota | JOB-2716723
Job Description:
Come practice in a North Dakota city on the border of Minnesota. The area has a low cost of living, clean air, and a tight-knit community of kind people. The city has a large university which supports sports, culture, research, and education.
CompHealth has employed positions, partnership-track opportunities, and independent contractor positions, so you can choose what is best for you. These positions offer a variety of compensations and benefits that can be discussed with your consultant to best fit your needs.
Please contact Trevor Jensen at 866-612-4941 or send your CV to CompHealth.
Quick Facts:
Be a hospital-employed physician at a community-owned and physician-led health system
Salary guarantee or your work RVUs, whichever is greater

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Job Description:
A new orthopedic surgeon opportunity is now available in Texas. Both newly trained foot and ankle fellows or general orthopedists with foot and ankle experience will be considered. Mondays and Wednesdays are OR days, clinic is on Tuesday, Thursday, and ½ day Friday, and call is 1:5. Each surgeon has a scribe. They will consider board certified and board eligible candidates, and both 2020 and 2021 fellows. The patient experience and quality of care is very important for them.
This position offers a two-year salary guarantee as you ramp up to an RVU model and production/performance bonuses paid quarterly. You will also receive malpractice insurance, medical benefits, life/disability insurance, CME, a retirement plan, a sign-on bonus, and relocation assistance.
At CompHealth, we are experts at matching you with your just-right job. Every step of the way, you will be supported by specialty teams comprised of tenured professionals. Our goal is to make a difference in the lives of our physicians and the healthcare communities they serve.

Qualified Candidates & Details:

Duke University Hospital is consistently rated as one of the best in the United States and is known around the world for its outstanding care and groundbreaking research. Duke University Hospital has 957 inpatient beds and offers comprehensive diagnostic and therapeutic facilities, including a regional emergency/trauma center; a major surgery suite containing 51 operating rooms; an endo-surgery center; an Ambulatory Surgery Center with nine operating rooms and an extensive diagnostic and interventional radiology area. In fiscal year 2018, Duke University Hospital admitted 42,916 patients and had 1,085,740 outpatient visits in fiscal year 2017.

U.S News & World Report named Duke University Hospital #1 in North Carolina and #1 in the Raleigh-Durham area in 2018-19.

Are you inspired by helping people? So are we!
Who We Are:
iConsult Healthcare, Inc. is a multi-specialty telemedicine group, specializing in providing high quality accessible consultative services to patients wherever they may reside. iConsult’s mission is to provide our patients with quality, timely, compassionate care in the setting they currently reside.
Our service has been designed to provide seamless and effective care to you and your patients. Our process begins with an iConsult physician who evaluates the patient at a convenient time. With access to medical records prior to the visit, we can improve the patient care experience and provide a thorough and complete consult. Our services address the range of patient care needs and eliminate the alternative time-consuming physician office visit or costly emergency room visit, which could lead to a readmission.

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Job description
Summary
Elite Foot and Ankle is a busy practice in the heart of Burbank, CA. Our practice covers all areas of general podiatry as well as surgery, trauma, and wound care. Our practice utilizes a state-of-the-art EHR, in-house digital x-rays, and in-house ultrasound.
We are looking for a full-time associate for all aspects of general podiatry. Our ideal candidate is eager to learn and work with the senior partner/doctor as well as show an ability to bring in new patients. This is a perfect position for a candidate who is looking for a part-time position. The part-time position may be converted to a full time position in the future if desired.
Requirements

We are looking for a Podiatrist to diagnose and treat minor or serious injuries and diseases of the feet, ankles and the lower part of legs. Podiatrist responsibilities include conducting foot and ankle surgeries, prescribing orthotics and applying therapeutic treatments for issues like arthritis, fractures and feet corn and calluses. To be considered for this role, you should have a doctoral degree in Podiatric Medicine and practical experience in a clinic or hospital. Ultimately, you will give our patients the best treatment based on their condition and help them recover as soon as possible.
Responsibilities
Examine patients’ legs to diagnose diseases
Perform foot and ankle surgeries (for example, removing bone spurs)
Treat sport-related foot and leg injuries, like fractures

We are seeking a Board eligible/certified Podiatrist for 3-4 days per week.
We are a busy independent pain management practice located in the Metro West area of suburban Boston with 2 NP’s, and a fluoroscopy suite, with radiofrequency and extensive use of ultrasound.
You will be joining 1 Physician and 2 Nurse Practitioners focused on office based interventional procedures. Specifically, you will be focusing on ultrasound guided procedures and we are willing to train you. You will work collaboratively with our Medical Director.
The ideal candidate will have competence in procedures, excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated leadership skills, a successful work ethic and a record of excellence in medical education and practice.

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Job Title: Physician: Podiatrist Opportunity in North Dakota | JOB-2716723
Job Description:
Come practice in a North Dakota city on the border of Minnesota. The area has a low cost of living, clean air, and a tight-knit community of kind people. The city has a large university which supports sports, culture, research, and education.
CompHealth has employed positions, partnership-track opportunities, and independent contractor positions, so you can choose what is best for you. These positions offer a variety of compensations and benefits that can be discussed with your consultant to best fit your needs.
Please contact Trevor Jensen at 866-612-4941 or send your CV to CompHealth.
Quick Facts:
Be a hospital-employed physician at a community-owned and physician-led health system
Salary guarantee or your work RVUs, whichever is greater

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

Duke University Hospital is consistently rated as one of the best in the United States and is known around the world for its outstanding care and groundbreaking research. U.S News & World Report named Duke University Hospital #1 in North Carolina and #1 in the Raleigh-Durham area in 2018-19.

Are you inspired by helping people? So are we!
Who We Are:
iConsult Healthcare, Inc. is a multi-specialty telemedicine group, specializing in providing high quality accessible consultative services to patients wherever they may reside. iConsult’s mission is to provide our patients with quality, timely, compassionate care in the setting they currently reside.
Our service has been designed to provide seamless and effective care to you and your patients. Our process begins with an iConsult physician who evaluates the patient at a convenient time. With access to medical records prior to the visit, we can improve the patient care experience and provide a thorough and complete consult. Our services address the range of patient care needs and eliminate the alternative time-consuming physician office visit or costly emergency room visit, which could lead to a readmission.

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.

JOB SUMMARY
The Podiatrist Physician provides medical care for patients with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. Diagnose illnesses, treat injuries, and perform procedures involving the lower extremities. Treat arch problems; ankle and foot injuries, deformities, and infections; and foot complaints associated with diabetes and other diseases. Prescribe drugs and physical therapy, and set fractures. Fit corrective shoe inserts called orthotics, design plaster casts and strapping to correct deformities.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS
Perform histories, physicals and prescribes diagnostic, education, preventive and/or treatment plan within the standards of accepted medical practice.
